job.name: IRIS_Deploy_Predict_Flower_Classifier_Model_Interactive

variable.name: WORK_DIR
variable.description: Working directory for the data space used to transfer files automatically between the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM
variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, it will activate the use of GPU for the workflow tasks on the selected container platform.

variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: The service instance name.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_PROXYFIED
variable.description: True if a proxy is needed to protect the access to this model-service endpoint.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_ENTRYPOINT
variable.description: This entry script starts the service and defines the different functions to deploy the model, scores the prediction requests based on the deployed model, and returns the results.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_YAML_FILE
variable.description: A YAML file that describes the OpenAPI Specification ver. 2 (known as Swagger Spec) of the service. This file should be stored in the catalog under the model_as_service_resources bucket.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_USER_NAME
variable.description: A valid username having the needed privileges to execute this action.

variable.name: MODEL_SERVICE_NODE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the node where the service will be deployed. If empty, the service will be deployed on an available node selected randomly.

variable.name: USE_NVIDIA_RAPIDS
variable.description: If True, the service will be configured to use the GPU and the Nvidia Rapids library.

variable.name: SERVICE_TOKEN
variable.description: A valid token generated by the MaaS_ML Service for user authentication.

variable.name: DRIFT_DETECTION_WINDOW_SIZE
variable.description: The size of the data to be extracted from the old training dataset to be used as a baseline data for the drift detection.

variable.name: DATA_DRIFT_DETECTOR
variable.description: The name of the data drift detector to be used in the drift detection process.

job.description: Train an Iris Flower Classifier, deploy it in a service and call the prediction endpoint to do the predictions.

task.name: Wait_for_Signal
task.description: A template task that sends a ready notification for all the signals specified in the variable SIGNALS, then loops until one signal among those specified is received by the job.

variable.name: SIGNALS
variable.description: The list of comma-separated signals expected by this task.

script.code:
import urllib.request import ssl import pandas as pd
global variables
# ------------------------------------------------------------- # Import an external python script containing a collection of # common utility Python functions and classes #PA_CATALOG_REST_URL = variables.get("PA_CATALOG_REST_URL") #PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL = PA_CATALOG_REST_URL + "/buckets/ai-machine-learning/resources/Utils_Script/raw" #if PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL.startswith('https'): # exec(urllib.request.urlopen(PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL, context=ssl._create_unverified_context()).read(), globals()) #else: # exec(urllib.request.urlopen(PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL).read(), globals()) #global get_input_variables #global raiser_ex # -------------------------------------------------------------
input_variables = { 'task.dataframe_id_test': None, 'task.dataframe_id': None, 'task.label_column': None, 'task.feature_names': None, } #get_input_variables(input_variables) input_variables['task.dataframe_id_test'] = variables.get("task.dataframe_id_test") input_variables['task.label_column'] = variables.get("task.label_column") input_variables['task.feature_names'] = variables.get("task.feature_names")
resultMetadata.put("task.dataframe_id_test", input_variables['task.dataframe_id_test']) resultMetadata.put("task.label_column", input_variables['task.label_column']) resultMetadata.put("task.feature_names", input_variables['task.feature_names'])
print("Loop block start ", str(variables.get('PA_TASK_ITERATION')))

task.name: Get_Parameters
task.description: The simplest task, ran by a Python engine.

script.code:
import urllib.request import ssl import pandas as pd
global variables
# ------------------------------------------------------------- # Get schedulerapi access and acquire session id schedulerapi.connect() sessionid = schedulerapi.getSession()
# ------------------------------------------------------------- # Import an external python script containing a collection of # common utility Python functions and classes
SERVICE_TOKEN = variables.get("SERVICE_TOKEN") PA_CATALOG_REST_URL = variables.get("PA_CATALOG_REST_URL") PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL = PA_CATALOG_REST_URL + "/buckets/ai-machine-learning/resources/Utils_Script/raw" req = urllib.request.Request(PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL) req.add_header('sessionid', sessionid) if PA_PYTHON_UTILS_URL.startswith('https'): content = urllib.request.urlopen(req, context=ssl._create_unverified_context()).read() else: content = urllib.request.urlopen(req).read() exec(content, globals())
global get_input_variables global raiser_ex # -------------------------------------------------------------
input_variables = { 'task.dataframe_id_test': None, 'task.dataframe_id': None, 'task.label_column': None, 'task.feature_names': None, } get_input_variables(input_variables)
#resultMetadata.put("task.dataframe_id_test", input_variables['task.dataframe_id_test']) #resultMetadata.put("task.label_column", input_variables['task.label_column']) #resultMetadata.put("task.feature_names", input_variables['task.feature_names'])
variables.put("task.dataframe_id_test",input_variables['task.dataframe_id_test']) variables.put("task.label_column",input_variables['task.label_column']) variables.put("task.feature_names",input_variables['task.feature_names'])
variables.put("SERVICE_TOKEN", SERVICE_TOKEN)

task.name: Load_Iris_Dataset
task.description: Load and return the iris dataset classification.

variable.name: TASK_ENABLED
variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored, it will not be executed.

variable.name: IMPORT_FROM
variable.description: Method/protocol to import the data from the data source.

variable.name: FILE_PATH
variable.description: Path or name of the file that contains the dataset.

variable.name: FILE_DELIMITER
variable.description: Delimiter to use.

variable.name: LABEL_COLUMN
variable.description: Label/class column name.

variable.name: LIMIT_OUTPUT_VIEW
variable.description: Number of rows that will be previewed in the browser.

task.name: Split_Data
task.description: Separate data into training and testing sets.

variable.name: TASK_ENABLED
variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored, it will not be executed.

variable.name: TRAIN_SIZE
variable.description: Float number within the range (0.0, 1.0), not including the values 0.0 and 1.0.

variable.name: LIMIT_OUTPUT_VIEW
variable.description: Number of rows that will be previewed in the browser.

task.name: Support_Vector_Machines
task.description: Support Vector Machines are supervised learning models with associated learning algorithms that analyze data used for classification.

variable.name: TASK_ENABLED
variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored, it will not be executed.

variable.name: INPUT_VARIABLES
variable.description: Parameters' values of the support vector machines algorithm.

variable.name: TASK_ENABLED
variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored, it will not be executed.

variable.name: LABEL_COLUMN
variable.description: Label/class column name.

variable.name: N_SPLITS
variable.description: Number of splits you want to perform on the data.

task.name: MaaS_ML_Service_Start
task.description: Start a model server to deploy ML models.

variable.name: SERVICE_ID
variable.description: The name of the service. Please keep the default value for this variable.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the service that will be deployed.

variable.name: ENGINE
variable.description: The container platform that will be used (no container, docker, singularity, or podman).

variable.name: PROXYFIED
variable.description: True if a proxy is needed to protect the access to this model-service endpoint. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_PROXYFIED workflow variable.

variable.name: PYTHON_ENTRYPOINT
variable.description: This entry script starts the service and defines the different functions to deploy the model, scores the prediction requests based on the deployed model, and returns the results. This script is specific to your model. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_ENTRYPOINT workflow variable.

variable.name: YAML_FILE
variable.description: A YAML file that describes the OpenAPI Specification ver. 2 (known as Swagger Spec) of the service. This file should be stored in the catalog under the model_as_service_resources bucket. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_YAML_FILE workflow variable.

variable.name: USER_NAME
variable.description: A valid username having the needed privileges to execute this action. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_USER_NAME workflow variable.

variable.name: NODE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the node where the service will be deployed. If empty, the service will be deployed on an available node selected randomly. It takes by default the value of MODEL_SERVICE_NODE_NAME workflow variable.

variable.name: GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, the service will be configured to use the GPU and the Nvidia Rapids library.

variable.name: DEPLOY_MODEL_ENDPOINT
variable.description: A URL endpoint defined by the user where the AI Model was deployed.

variable.name: API_EXTENSION
variable.description: The base path to access the deployment endpoint.

variable.name: MODEL_URL
variable.description: A valid URL specified by the user referencing the model that needs to be deployed.

variable.name: SERVICE_TOKEN
variable.description: A valid token generated by the MaaS_ML Service for user authentication.

variable.name: DRIFT_DETECTION_WINDOW_SIZE
variable.description: The size of the data to be extracted from the old training dataset to be used as a baseline data for the drift detection.

variable.name: LOG_PREDICTIONS
variable.description: If true, the resulted predictions will be logged in the traceability page.

variable.name: MODEL_NAME
variable.description: The name of the model to be deployed.

variable.name: MODEL_VERSION
variable.description: The version number of the model that will be deployed.

variable.name: BASELINE_DATA_URL
variable.description: The URL of the dataset to be deployed and used in the data drift detection process.

task.name: MaaS_ML_Call_Prediction
task.description: Call the launched service to predict results based on the last deployed model.

variable.name: PREDICT_MODEL_ENDPOINT
variable.description: The endpoint of the started service.

variable.name: SERVICE_TOKEN
variable.description: A valid token generated by the MaaS_ML Service for user authentication.

variable.name: PREDICT_EXTENSION
variable.description: The base path to access the prediction endpoint.

variable.name: INPUT_DATA
variable.description: Entry data that needs to be scored by the deployed model.

variable.name: LABEL_COLUMN
variable.description: The name of the label column. It needs to be set if data is labeled.

variable.name: DATA_DRIFT_DETECTOR
variable.description: Name of the data drift detector to be used in the drift detection process.

variable.name: MODEL_NAME
variable.description: The name of the model to be deployed.

variable.name: MODEL_VERSION
variable.description: The version number of the model that will be deployed.

variable.name: SAVE_PREDICTIONS
variable.description: Save the resulted predictions in order to be able to display them through the data analytics dashboard.

variable.name: DRIFT_ENABLED
variable.description: True if a detector is needed to detect data drifts in the input data based on the baseline data.

variable.name: DRIFT_NOTIFICATION
variable.description: True if the user needs to get a notification via Proactive if a data drift is detected.

variable.name: LIMIT_OUTPUT_VIEW
variable.description: Maximum number of rows displayed in the output

task.name: MaaS_ML_Actions
task.description: Manage the life-cycle of MaaS_ML. This workflow trigger three possible actions: Pause_MaaS_ML, Resume_MaaS_ML and Finish_MaaS_ML.

variable.name: ACTION
variable.description: The action that will be processed regarding the service status.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: The name of the service that the action will be processed on.

variable.name: INSTANCE_ID
variable.description: The service instance ID.
